1567636880_1B8Nj3YZQSgw2aqhrHof5w73RpP6X.body: Also you can set ZN to use tor for tracker connections in settings assuming you are running the Tor Browser bundle, which is a good idea anyway.

1567787270_1BumxHqxXBHScLoq1wAJqiFZXJ4c1.body:
I'd say acceptable but not bulletproof. Without the Tor it's pretty much like bittorrent from what I gather. So might be hard to tell who the originator is but fairly easy to see who is "seeding" certain content. So Tor adds a lot to the security.

The benefit of using the Tor browser is that if malicious content tries to redirect you to a clearnet site, for "doxing" purposes, that would run through Tor as well.

1568735040_1Cy3ntkN2GN9MH6EaW6eHpi4YoRS2.body:
In the data/filters folder of that site there is what appears to be user blocklists grouped into anti_jew.json, anti_lgbt.json and licence_offending.json. So, no being woke to the JQ or criticizing trannies if you use KxoID?

Hard pass. The hardest pass. Awww...heyll...naw!

I'm not interested in any ID provider that is primed for censoring "badthink."

A semi-decentralized ID provider sounds good but if the "semi" part is run by an SJW that is a problem.

> [gitcenter](#comment_1002_1Cy3ntkN2GN9MH6EaW6eHpi4YoRS2nK5Di): And those blocklists weren't even finished AFAIK.

Yeah, like the Death Star wasn't finished lol (they have entries in them). Is everything Kxo related suspect? If someone gets banned on KxoNet would they be banned from the entire Kxo "family" of sites?

> [gitcenter](#comment_1004_1Cy3ntkN2GN9MH6EaW6eHpi4YoRS2nK5Di): Once KxoID gave you a certificate, it can no longer be revoked, so the only way to get "banned" from KxoID is actually not receiving the certificate in the first place.

I have reason to doubt this. Things can be removed/edited in ZN if one has the keys, that is how people can update their Zites.

In any event, even if an ID couldn't be revoked, it wouldn't matter because a central "authority" can just add IDs to a blocklist and push it out. My ID could be as valid as ever but it wouldn't mean anything because my content can be hidden per the blocklist.

> [gitcenter](#comment_1005_1Cy3ntkN2GN9MH6EaW6eHpi4YoRS2nK5Di): Looks like you don't understand how ZeroNet works. [...]

I believe you are being deliberately disingenuous. The fact is that KxoNet stuff has left-leaning blocklists baked in. From the code:

"The purpose of this blocklist is that jewish people shouldn't have to see or deal with anti-jew hate speech or derogatory comments towards them.  If you have made derogatory comments or hate speech against jews, then you'll be added to this list."

Aww, someone is thinking about the poor little Jews lol. Opt in or opt out, that is a Real Bad Sign (TM). Whoever has the main keys can just say:
"Due to the recent shooting in Wherevertown, USA we are updating our code to use the blocklists by default. Diversity of opinion is good but when that crosses the line to violence against innocent humans no reasonable people should support this. I realize the Kxo family of sites is now the biggest group on ZeroNet and this may cause some people alarm. We respect this opinion and hope that they will respect ours. Signed, FriskyDisabledPuppyBoyLover69"

...and you know damn well that is exactly how it would go down. Sweet Jeebus, its like I'm psychic or something. The Boogaloo can't come soon enough.

1568893908_1KkYDy7vnYwccFCDugksbCb4izK5H.body: Big if true. Tor/Tor Browser is open source. How would they hide a deliberate back door?

1570025997_19AdL7EWPFiXiep63Ahacx21EibX5.body: Oh heck yeah I use TOR. For ZN and anything particularly "spicy."

> [randomshits](#comment_189_1CuFETj5LtyEduzaoAcdv9sMAQtYRqjqDY): With a bit of safe browsing habits, tor is not necessary on the clearnet nor zeronet.Don't want to stumble on questionable or criminal material with that instance, then don't pursue it.

I don't agree with that. The onionshare guy was posting child porn on 08chan /b/ for a bit if I'm not mistaken, which would be the wrong place for content like that. Spammers are a thing and you can receive illegal content before you know to block somebody. Wasn't there some person who tried to "out" ZN users a bit back by exploiting the fact that not everyone was running Tor? ZN and Tor all on an encrypted container is base requirement for browsing in my opinion.

> [pexo](#comment_158_1DfrA2M9Qra6stqT6tzwNMYNweswY54KAC):  [...]

Agree. Also consider that depending on the context even *legal* information, sometimes that you can't even see, can be used against you in court. Say I decide to be "clever" and keep it legal but do some [FEDPOSTING]. Boom, this is now on your computer...and technically legal.

Now say you are walking home and are attacked by a black guy, defend yourself and he dies. If they search your computer my [FEDPOSTING] along with whatever else is on ZN is admissible evidence in a hate crime trial. It doesn't matter that you didn't say it, or maybe don't even agree with it, it will get trotted out in front of a jury for "context."

This normie idea of "But I'm not doing anything illegal. FBI Agent Glowburg is a fellow patriot.", is bullshit. The federal judicial system is full of straight...up...criminals... They are more than happy to railroad some poor schmuck into a fake hate crime conviction to pad their resume. Then maybe they can move up the ranks faster and might even get invited to Pedo Island v.2!

"No you aren't under arrest. But I'd like to ask you some questions if that is ok?"
-> I would need a lawyer present for that. Since I'm not under arrest I'd like to leave now.
